com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.storage

Class AdobePSDCompositeBranch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.storage.AdobePSDCompositeBranch
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdobePSDCompositeMutableBranch

    public class AdobePSDCompositeBranch
extends java.lang.Object
    AdobePSDCompositeBranch represent a branch of a PSD composite. PSD composites support multiple branches. Developers work with a current branch but have the ability to bring in other branches that can then be merged in.

      • countNodes

        public java.lang.Integer countNodes(AdobePSDLayerNode parentLayer,
                                    com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.adobeinternal.storage.psd.AdobePSDLayerNodeType type,
                                    boolean recursiveCount)
        Counts the number of layer nodes of the specified type.
        Parameters:
        parentLayer - must be either an existing layer node of type AdobePSDLayerNodeTypeGroup or null in which case the count will start at the root.
        type - the type of nodes to include in the count.
        recursiveCount - whether the count should recursively include the result from sub layers.
        Returns:
        the count of layer nodes of the specified type.

      • countLayerPixels

        public java.lang.Integer countLayerPixels(AdobePSDLayerNode parentLayer,
                                          com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.adobeinternal.storage.psd.AdobePSDLayerNodeType type,
                                          boolean recursiveCount)
        Counts the number of layer nodes of the specified type that have an pixel image component.
        Parameters:
        parentLayer - must be either an existing layer node of type AdobePSDLayerNodeTypeGroup or null in which case the count will start at the root.
        type - the type of nodes to include in the count.
        recursiveCount - whether the count should recursively include the result from sub layers.
        Returns:
        the count of layer nodes present of the specified type.

      • getLayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<AdobePSDLayerNode> getLayers(AdobePSDLayerNode parentLayer)
        Returns an array of layer nodes of the given parent layer.
        Parameters:
        parentLayer - must be either an existing layer node of type AdobePSDLayerNodeTypeGroup or null in which case the list of layer nodes at the root level will be returned.
        Returns:

      • getLayer

        public AdobePSDLayerNode getLayer(java.lang.Integer layerID)
        Returns the layer node with the given layer ID or null if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        layerID - the layer ID of the requested layer.
        Returns:
        AdobePSDLayerNode : the layer node with the given layer ID or null if it doesn't exist.

      • layerHasVisibleChildren

        public boolean layerHasVisibleChildren(AdobePSDLayerNode parentLayer,
                                       com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.adobeinternal.storage.psd.AdobePSDLayerNodeType typesMask,
                                       AdobePSDLayerComp layerComp,
                                       boolean recursive)
        Returns whether a layer contains any visible sub-layers, optionally taking into account the effects of an applied layer comp.
        Parameters:
        parentLayer - must be either an existing layer node of type AdobePSDLayerNodeTypeGroup or null in which case the check will start at the root.
        typesMask - bit mask specifying which layer types should be checked for visibility. AdobePSDLayerNodeTypeGroup bit mask will be ignored if recursive is true.
        layerComp - the optional layer comp to apply when checking for visibility.
        recursive - whether the check should recursively include the result from sub layers.
        Returns:
        true if any sub-layers of the specified types are visible. Note: When performing a recursive check, if a sub-layer group is invisible, then all of its children are considered invisible regardless of their visibility settings. If a recursive check is not performed, the layer group's visibility is included in the check only if provided as part of the bit mask of types to consider.

      • layerIsVisible

        public boolean layerIsVisible(AdobePSDLayerNode layer,
                              AdobePSDLayerComp layerComp)
        Returns whether a layer is visible, optionally taking into account the effects of an applied layer comp.
        Parameters:
        layer - the layer to check.
        layerComp - the optional layer comp to apply when checking for visibility.
        Returns:
        true if the layer is visible.

        public java.util.ArrayList getLayersIntersectingPath(com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.adobeinternal.storage.psd.Path path,
                                                     AdobePSDLayerComp comp)
        Returns a list of layer nodes that intersect the given path.
        Parameters:
        path - selected path.
        comp - the layer comp to search (optional). Pass null to omit.
        Returns:
        the list of layer nodes that intersect the given path.

        public boolean hasPixelsPath(AdobePSDLayerNode layer)
        Returns whether the pixels path of the given layer node exists.
        Parameters:
        layer - the layer node to check.
        Returns:

      • getPixelsPathOf

        public java.lang.String getPixelsPathOf(AdobePSDLayerNode layer)
                                 throws com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.adobeinternal.storage.dcx.AdobeDCXException
        Returns the file path for the pixels of the given layer node.
        Parameters:
        layer - the layer to return the pixels path for. This must be a layer node of type AdobePSDLayerNodeTypeRGBPixels.
        Returns:
        the file path for the pixels of the given layer node.
        Throws:
        com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.adobeinternal.storage.dcx.AdobeDCXException - if something goes wrong.
